text: The National Bank Surveillance System is a computerized, off-site monitoring systemhttp://www.investopedia.com/terms/n/national-bank-surveillance- system.asphttps://ssrn.com/abstract=631241 developed by the U.S. Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) "to assist in the early detection of problem banks and bank management," for the purpose of initiating early corrective action. Essentially an early-warning system, the NBSS was first implemented in 1975. It produces Bank Performance Reports (BPRs) as its primary analytical tool.http://www.gwu.edu/~ibi/minerva/Fall1998/Jose.Mazzillo.html ==Notes== Category:Banking in the United States Category:Surveillance
title: National Bank Surveillance System
